segments.text: I see the water from the sink just pouring out and forming a big puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's spreading everywhere, and no one seems to notice or care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying a plate like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be completely absorbed in her own world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so focused on getting cookies that they don't see the mess around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit sad seeing all this chaos and no one doing anything about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kitchen is turning into a disaster zone, and everyone is just ignoring it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how unaware everyone is about the water and the potential accidents.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm and tidy, unlike the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would just turn off the faucet and clean up the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene makes me feel a bit melancholic.
segments.speaker: PAR
